item.title: By: Yonatan
item.dc:creator: Yonatan
item.description:
I find the first statement difficult to swallow. I think that it unnecessarily and wrongly minimizes the differences between Christianity and Judaism.
I also find that it lacks the usability of the Dabru Emet statement. Dabru Emet deals with the Holocaust, social justice, truth in religion. In many ways, this is a very conservative statement.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description: The problem may not be the encounter with other faiths but the losing of any sense of diversity or alternatives. Third grade social studies, which goes back to the Margret Mead era of appreciating different cultures, way to each that there are different ways to live. Many of our classrooms have lost the appreciation of the other lifestyles and turn it into "thank God that we are not like them."
